description: From French galvaniser, from galvanisme, named after Italian physiologist Luigi Aloisio Galvani (1737–1798).

verbs.description: galvanize (third-person singular simple present galvanizes, present participle galvanizing, simple past and past participle galvanized) (transitive)

entries.meaning: (chemistry) To coat with a thin layer of metal by electrochemical means.
(figurative) To shock or stimulate into sudden activity, as if by electric shock.
examples: The girl’s picture helped galvanize public opinion against the administration’s policy.
Republicans are hoping a proposed gas-tax repeal will galvanize their voters.
The agitations resembled the grinnings and writhings of a galvanized corpse, not the struggles of an athletic man.

entries.meaning: (historical, US) To switch sides between Union and Confederate in the American Civil War.
